alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 1:18AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern McCurtain County through 145 AM CST... At 118 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Nashoba, or 20 miles southeast of Clayton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Plunketville, Watson, Bethel, Battiest, Pickens and Smithville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CST for southeastern Oklahoma.
